author: mina battiwala
text: "I've been eating at this place from long time.  Hands down
column5: one of the top pizzerias.  True traditional Italian pizza from .\n\nThe pizza may not be everyone's cup of tea.  Super thin crust
column6: lots of sauce and cheese
column7: with a slight smoked flavor as they use real pizza ovens.\n\nTalk about consistent!  The slices are the same every time
column8: even nearly years later.  I don't think I've had a single bad slice."

author: J Ashley
text: "Prices are soooooo much higher than they should be considering the quality. I don't think they put any salt in the alfredo I ordered. The fact that they've survived this long without changing either the price or the quality. It's truly astounding. Would definitely not recommend. Just do a Google search any option is better. Trust me."

text: 'I just moved to Hoboken and wanted to try out some local pizza. This place did not disappoint!!!! Amazing flavor

I would need to eat at least 2 slices for snack when 2 would normally do it.\nAgain its Okay... for an over priced cheese slice...this is the place!!"

The large pie came out and it was not a large pie it was the same size as the medium pie and it  was doughy. The medium pie that had onions was raw.'

author: Dustin Glass
text: 'New italian/pizza place to the neighborhood does not disappoint. The chicken cutlet sandwiches are large and excellent quality (try the "Hbroken"). The gnocchi with broccoli
column5: pine nuts

Oddly enough we have yet to try the actual pizza but that is next.\n\n*update* the food has still been good but on one occasion I ordered a hot pepper and pepperoni pizza that was not great. Some of the stems were still on the peppers and they were cooked under the cheese
column7: making the pizza very runny. (As a result
column10: and chicken soup... all were very very good. I have also had pizza slices from here that were tasty as well; it was just the one aforementioned pizza that was lacking. Overall

text: 'Great pizza & fantastic people!  Never had a bad meal there !'

author: kral ulklcu
text: 'Buffalo chicken pizza pie so delicious'

author: John Rauh
text: "I went to Pizzeria Hoboken a few weeks ago to try out their pizza because I heard all the buzz that their pizza is the best in Hoboken. Well
column5: the buzz was right on the money. The specialty pizza slices I had were some of the best pizza I have EVER had. No Joke.  I had the Buffalo Chicken Pizza and the BBQ Chicken Pizza slices and they were Big Slices and very filling. Don't take my word for it
column6: order from Pizzeria Hoboken on Jefferson Street. You will not be sorry."

author: shaileshkumar patel
text: "Pizza is delicious.Nice sitting place .BYOB they're friendly."

author: Matthew Benson
text: "Very Expensive. The pizza was tasty but also soggy.  Slices are huge and ingredients are good.  Pretty generic decor
column5: lacking a personal touch.  Servers are friendly.  I like it and will be going back
column6: but I probably wouldn't stop by if I didn't live 2 blocks away."

author: Johnny Chen
text: 'Pizza was OK. Be careful and very clear up front about pricing and your order.  Their pricing is wrong and deceptive.\n\n- Fountain soda showed $2
column5: but I was charged $2.50.\n- Pizza showed $3.75
column6:
but I was charged $4.
- Ordered one $8 salad to share between two people and they "misunderstood" it to be two orders of salad.  Worst $16 of my life.

Ended up paying over $30 for 2 slices of pizza
column8: and 2 flat fountain sodas.\n\nWhen asking them about it they just played dumb and said it was tax
column9: even though there was already another line item for taxes.\n\nHorrible business practices for a local pizza joint. It\'s unfortunate that they\'re trying to shaft locals who could easily become regular customers.'

author: Tom Koty
text:
"Pizza was OK. I wouldn't order again.

What was really disturbing:
$3.50 for a 16oz soda
$4.00 for a single vegetable topping
$5.00 for a meat topping

I don't mind paying extra (or a lot) for exceptional pizza and toppings. This was neither."
